briefTitle: Exercise Intervention Study for Early-Stage Breast Cancer Patients Receiving Neoadjuvant Therapy.
officialTitle: The Effects of Exercise Training on Tumor Vascularity and Response to Neoadjuvant Therapy in Operable Breast Cancer: A Phase I-II Study
primaryOutcomeMeasure: Determine effects of endurance exercise training on cardiopulmonary fitness via a stress test
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Histologically confirmed operable primary breast cancer
* Age 18 or older
* Karnofsky performance status greater than 70
* No previous malignancy
* Absence of significant cardiac disease (left ventricular ejection fraction greater than or equal to 50%)
* No hormonal replacement therapy use within the past month
* Not pregnant
* Ability to read and understand English
* Signed written informed consent prior to beginning protocol specific procedures
* Willing to travel to DUMC to exercise three times per week
* Primary treating oncologist approval
